options.text: Azure Foundations enables hybrid network connectivity with an on premises environment using the Hub & Spoke network topology. Please note, all network connectivity components will be deployed to the Platform Subscription.

elements.name: esAddress
elements.label: Address space (required for Virtual Hub)
elements.toolTip: Provide address prefix in CIDR notation (e.g 192.168.0.0/16)

constraints.validationMessage: Virtual network's address space, specified as a CIDR notation (e.g. 10.49.0.0/18)

options.text: You can optionally provide subscriptions for your first landing zones for both 'online' and 'corp' and assign recommended policies that will ensure workloads will be secure, monitored, and protected according to best practices.
Select the subscriptions you want to move to online management group.
Select the subscriptions you want to move to corp management group.
Select which of the the recommended policies you will assign to your landing zones.

elements.name: esVmMonitoring
elements.label: Ensure Azure VMs (Windows & Linux) are being monitored
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continous compliance

elements.name: esVmssMonitoring
elements.label: Ensure Azure VMSS (Windows & Linux) are being monitored
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continous compliance

elements.name: esArcVmMonitoring
elements.label: Ensure Azure Arc VMs (Windows & Linux) are being monitored
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continous compliance

elements.name: esAksPolicy
elements.label: Enable Kubernetes (AKS) for Azure Policy
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continous compliance

elements.name: esAksPriv
elements.label: Prevent privileged containers in Kubernetes clusters
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, policy will be assigned to prevent privileged containers in AKS

elements.name: esAksNoPriv
elements.label: Prevent privileged escalation in Kubernetes clusters
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, policy will be assigned to prevent privileged escalations in AKS

elements.name: esAksIngress
elements.label: Ensure HTTPS ingress is enforced in Kubernetes clusters
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, HTTPS ingress will be required in AKS

elements.name: esAzBackup
elements.label: Ensure Azure VMs (Windows & Linux) are enabled for Azure Backup
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned and enable Azure Backup on all VMs in the landing zones.

elements.name: esDenyRdp
elements.label: Prevent inbound RDP from internet
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned and prevent inbound RDP from internet

elements.name: esNsg
elements.label: Ensure subnets are associated with NSG
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure NSGs must be associated with subnets being created

elements.name: esIpForwarding
elements.label: Prevent IP forwarding
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned and prevent IP forwarding

elements.name: esSqlEncryption
elements.label: Ensure Azure SQL is enabled with transparent data encryption
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected when also adding a subscription for management, ARM will deploy resources and enable them for continous compliance

elements.name: esSqlAudit
elements.label: Ensure auditing is enabled on Azure SQL
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure auditing is enabled on Azure SQLs

elements.name: esHttpsStorage
elements.label: Ensure secure connections (HTTPS) to storage accounts
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure storage can only be accessed using HTTPS
